category: I. The Lost Continent (Kumari Kandam) & Ancient Geography

questions.question: Into how many specific territories (Nadus) was the ancient Kumari Kandam divided, and can you name the seven major divisions?
questions.answer: It was divided into 49 territories. The seven major divisions were Ezhu Thenga Nadu, Ezhu Madurai Nadu, Ezhu Munpalai Nadu, Ezhu Pinpalai Nadu, Ezhu Kunra Nadu, Ezhu Gunakarai Nadu, and Ezhu Kurumpanai Nadu.

questions.question: What specific river, according to the text, originated from the Meru Mountain in Kumari Kandam and flowed eastward into the ocean?
Which Chola King is credited with establishing the "Solar Dynasty" (So-La) after migrating from the submerged Kumari Kandam to the "Mina Desam" (Egypt/Middle East)?
According to the text, the Vindhya Mountains were originally known by which name connected to a Chola King?
Which ancient continent (Dwipa) corresponds to the region of modern-day Greece and Turkey, and why was it named so?
questions.answer: Krauncha Dwipa (Bird Island/Heron Island), named because of the abundance of birds like herons and cranes.

questions.question: Who ruled the "Monkey Land" and "Tiger Land" in the Salmala Dwipa before the Great Deluge forced them to migrate to India?
questions.answer: The Vanaras (Monkey clan) and the ancestors of the Cholas (Tiger flag).

questions.question: What geological explanation does the text give for the "Seven Seas" mentioned in Puranas (Milk Ocean, Curd Ocean, etc.)?
questions.answer: They were named after the color or nature of the water (White river/Pale river), not literally containing milk or curd.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King excavated the Pahruli River to irrigate the Peruvala Nadu?
According to the text’s chronology, when did the "First Great Deluge" occur that submerged the Peruvian/Kumari lands?
Which mountain range does the text identify as the "Meru Mountain," explicitly stating it is not the Himalayas?
questions.answer: A mountain range that existed in the center of the Indian Ocean (Kumari Kandam) with 49 peaks.

questions.question: Who were the specific patron deities and sages of the First Sangam (Thalai Sangam)?
What was the capital city of the Middle Sangam (Idai Sangam)?
Which Pandyan King presided over the Last Sangam (Kadai Sangam)?
How many years did the Middle Sangam last, and how many poets were part of it?
questions.answer: It lasted 3,700 years with 3,700 poets (including Agastya and Tolkappiyar).

questions.question: Which rare grammar text served as the standard during the First Sangam?
Which Pandyan King was cursed by Agastya to become an elephant (Indradyumna) and was later redeemed by Vishnu?
What literary work mentions that 89 Pandyan Kings patronized the First Sangam?
questions.answer: The commentary by Nakkirar on Irayanar Akapporul.

questions.question: Which Pandyan King ruled when the Second Sangam's capital, Kapadapuram, was submerged?
questions.answer: Mudathirumaran (who then moved to North Madurai).

questions.question: Who were the "Seven Patrons" (Kadai Ezhu Vallalgal) of the Last Sangam era?
questions.answer: Pari, Ori, Kari, Adhiyaman, Began, Ay, and Nalli.

questions.question: Which text was authorized by the Middle Sangam and remains the oldest extant Tamil grammar?
Based on astronomical calculations cited in the text, what is the exact birth date of Lord Rama?
Which Chola King was the contemporary of Lord Rama and participated in the events of that era?
Who was the Pandyan King reigning during the time of the Ramayana?
What relation was the demon king Ravana to the god of wealth, Kubera?
questions.answer: They were half-brothers (sons of Sage Visravas).

questions.question: Which Chera King is said to have defeated Ravana when he tried to enter the Tamil country?
questions.answer: Mandaran Cheral (or simply the Chera King at the time).

questions.question: According to the text, which Sage gave the "Aditya Hridayam" mantra to Rama, and where did this happen?
questions.answer: Agastya, during Rama's stay in the Tamil lands/Dandakaranya.

questions.question: Who was the father of King Dasharatha?
Which Chola King married the daughter of King Vikukshi of the Solar Dynasty?
According to the text, when did the Rama-Ravana war take place?
Who founded the city of Mathura after killing the Asura Lavana?
What was the name of the Chola King who gave his own flesh to save a dove, linking the Chola lineage to the "Sibi" legend?
Which ancient sage is claimed to be the ancestor of the Cholas, Pandyas, and Cheras via his marriage to a Vidarbha princess?
Who was the wife of the sage Rishyasringa, who performed the Putra Kameshti Yaga for Dasharatha?
Which Solar Dynasty king was cursed to become a "Chandala" (outcast) and had a new heaven created for him by Viswamitra?
Who was the mother of Ravana?
What is the exact calculated birth date of Lord Krishna in the text?
When did Kali Yuga officially begin according to the text?
Which Chera King is famous for feeding both the Pandava and Kaurava armies during the 18-day war?
Who was the Pandyan King during the Mahabharatha War who fought on the side of the Pandavas?
Which Chola King participated in the Mahabharatha War?
Who wrote the Tamil version of the Mahabharatha during the Sangam age?
What happened to the city of Dwaraka 36 years after the Mahabharatha War?
questions.answer: It was submerged by the sea due to a natural calamity/tsunami.

questions.question: Who was the only son of Dhritarashtra to survive the war (fighting for the Pandavas)?
Who was the Naga princess who married Arjuna and bore the son Iravan?
What is the text's claim regarding the complexion of Veda Vyasa and Krishna?
questions.answer: They were black (Dravidian complexion), challenging the "white Aryan" theory.

questions.question: Who succeeded the Pandavas to the throne of Hastinapura?
Which Rishi cursed King Parikshit to die by snakebite?
Who performed the "Sarpa Yaga" (Snake Sacrifice) to avenge Parikshit's death?
According to the text, where did Ashwatthama migrate after the war?
questions.answer: To the Arabian/Iraq region (specifically Kufa), linking him to later Semitic lineages.

questions.question: Which Chola King is said to have married Subhadra (Krishna’s sister) in a previous birth legend mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: Manojava Pandyan (Note: Text attributes this to a Pandyan in the context of Thiruthangal).

category: V. Religious Syncretism (Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, Islam, Christianity)

questions.question: Who was Pandyan Pulathiyan and what is his shocking connection to the Bible?
questions.answer: He was a Pandyan governor in Judaea, identified as Pontius Pilate, who presided over the trial of Jesus.

questions.question: According to the text, where did Jesus Christ (Iso) spend his "lost years" studying?
questions.answer: At Nalanda University (Buddhism) and in Mylapore/Chennai (Jainism/Saivism).

questions.question: Who was the Tamil Siddha said to be a descendant of Ashwatthama living in Iraq?
How is Siddhan Bhoga Dathan connected to the history of Islam in the text?
questions.answer: He protected the family of Hussein (grandson of Prophet Muhammad) during the conflict at Karbala.

questions.question: Which Hindu saint is claimed to have died fighting alongside Hussein?
What date does the text provide for the birth of Prophet Muhammad?
Who was the 24th Tirthankara of Jainism and which Magadha King was his contemporary?
Which Pandyan King was converted from Jainism to Saivism by Sambandar?
According to the text, where did Adi Sankara establish his Mutts?
questions.answer: Kanchipuram, Sringeri, Dwaraka, Badri, and Puri.

questions.question: What is the text's revised birth date for Adi Sankara?
Who was the Buddhist monk from Kanchipuram who spread Buddhism to China?
Which Tamil epic is explicitly stated to be a Buddhist work?
Which Tamil epic is explicitly stated to be a Jain work?
Who founded the Visishtadvaita philosophy?
Which Chola King persecuted Ramanujar, forcing him to flee to Melkote?
Who founded the Dvaita philosophy?
Who established the Samarasa Suddha Sanmargam?
Who was the disciple of Jesus who came to Mylapore, India?
According to the text, where did Jesus die?
Who was the guru of Guru Nanak (founder of Sikhism)?
questions.answer: He had no human guru but preached a path of love uniting Hindus and Muslims.

questions.question: When was the mathematician Aryabhatta born according to the text?
What specific astronomical fact did Aryabhatta state about the Earth centuries before Galileo?
questions.answer: That the Earth rotates on its axis and orbits the Sun.

questions.question: Who discovered the concept of Zero according to the text?
Who is considered the father of Siddha Medicine?
How many diseases are classified in the Tamil Siddha medical system?
Which Tamil poetess is credited with knowledge of Atomic Science (Anu)?
questions.answer: Avvaiyar (citing her verse on splitting the atom).

questions.question: What ancient text is cited as containing knowledge about electricity and batteries?
Who wrote the Vimaana Nool (Book on Aircraft/Space Travel)?
What is the "Sanjeevi" herb mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: A herb found in the Himalayas capable of reviving the dead.

questions.question: What is the "Mu-ppu" in Siddha medicine?
questions.answer: A universal salt/catalyst used for rejuvenation and medicine.

questions.question: What represents the speed of light in the text's Vedic calculations (by Sayana)?
Who wrote the mathematical text Lilavati?
What is the Tamil name for the planet Saturn?
What is the Tamil name for the planet Jupiter?
Who performed the first cataract surgery according to Indian history?
Who established the Vikrama Era in 55 B.C.?
Who established the Salivahana Era (Saka Era) in 78 A.D.?
questions.answer: Salivahana (a potter's son who became King).

questions.question: Who were the "Nootruvar Kannar" mentioned in Tamil literature?
Who built the Big Temple (Brihadeeswarar) in Thanjavur?
Which Chola King conquered the Ganges and assumed the title "Gangai Konda Cholan"?
Who founded the Vijayanagara Empire to protect Hinduism?
questions.answer: Harihara and Bukka, guided by Sage Vidyaranya.

questions.question: Who was the famous Nayak King of Madurai known for his palace?
Who was the Maratha King who ruled Thanjavur and was a scholar?
Who established the Maratha Kingdom and fought Aurangzeb?
Who was Shivaji's spiritual Guru?
Who was the Brahmin minister of Chandragupta Maurya who wrote the Arthashastra?
Which Greek ambassador visited Chandragupta Maurya's court?
Who was the Hun leader known for his cruelty in North India?
Which Pallava King was converted from Jainism to Saivism by Appar?
Who built the Shore Temple at Mahabalipuram?
Who wrote the Thirukkural?
How many couplets does the Thirukkural contain?
Who was Thiruvalluvar's wife?
Who wrote the Silappathikaram?
Who wrote the Manimekalai?
Who wrote the Kamba Ramayanam?
Who was the patron of the poet Kambar?
Who wrote the Periya Puranam?
Who wrote the Thiruppugazh?
Who wrote the Thiruvasagam?
Who wrote the Thirumandiram?
Who composed the Thiruppavai?
Who composed the Tiruvaimozhi?
What is the "Sangam Plank" (Sanga Palagai)?
questions.answer: A miraculous plank in the Golden Lotus Tank of Madurai that judged the worthiness of manuscripts.

questions.question: Who was the court poet of the Chola King Kulothunga II (Anapaya)?
Which poetess lived for a very long time by eating a "Nelli" (Gooseberry) fruit?
Who wrote the Aathichudi?
Who wrote the Kanda Puranam?
Who is the author of Villiputhurar Bharatham?
Which Chola King recovered the lost Thevaram manuscripts?
What script does the author propose for the Tamil language to foster integration?
What connects the "Mayan" civilization to India according to the text?
questions.answer: They are claimed to be descendants of the Asura architect Maya (Mayan).

questions.question: Who created the Telugu language according to the text?
Who founded the Fourth Tamil Sangam in 1901?
What represents the "Colossus of Rhodes" mentioned in the text?
questions.answer: A giant statue of the Sun God that fell during an earthquake around 200 A.D.

questions.question: Which Tamil King is said to have sent a delegation to Augustus Caesar?
What is the origin of the word "Dravidian" according to the text?
questions.answer: From "Thiravidar", meaning those who ran/migrated (from the deluge).

questions.question: Who was the "Negro" King listed as a patron of the Tamil Sangam?
Which Siddha is said to have entered the body of a parrot?
Which Siddha is said to have entered the body of a shepherd named Moolan?
Who is Manikandan?
Who cured the "Hunchback Pandyan" (Koon Pandyan)?
Who revived the girl Poompavai from her ashes/bones?
What is the significance of "Jyothi" in Ramalinga Vallalar's philosophy?
Who wrote the Abhidhamma Pitaka?
questions.answer: It is part of the Buddhist Tripitaka (philosophical texts).

questions.question: Who was the Chola King who invaded Kalinga, celebrated in Kalingattuparani?
Who destroyed the "Hanging Forts" (Thoongu Eyil)?
What festival's cessation caused the destruction of Poompuhar?
Who was the Greek King mentioned as "Yavana" in Indian texts?
questions.answer: Referring to Ionians (Greeks), specifically Alexander or later Indo-Greek rulers.

questions.question: Which Tamil King ruled Egypt according to the text?
questions.answer: Kings with the title "Kari" (related to the Chera/Velir lineage).

questions.question: Who was the first King of the Sisunaga Dynasty of Magadha?
Who was the last King of the Nanda Dynasty?
Who was the son of Bindusara?
Who founded the Sunga Dynasty?
Who founded the Kanva Dynasty?
Who was the greatest ruler of the Gupta Dynasty?
Who was the King of Kalinga defeated by Ashoka?
questions.answer: (Not named, but the Kalinga War is the event).

questions.question: Who was the Pandyan King who standardized land measurement (Nilan Tharu)?
Who was the Chola King who built the dam Kallanai?
Who was the Chola King known as "Manuneethi Cholan" for executing his son to provide justice to a cow?
Who was the Pallava King who was a great wrestler (Mamalla)?
Who was the Chalukya King defeated by Narasimhavarman I?
Who was the Rashtrakuta King who built the Ellora Kailasanatha temple?

Who was the famous Kakatiya King (or Queen)?
Who was the Chola King who conquered Kadaram (Malaysia)?
Who built the Angkor Wat temple?
Who was the Pandyan King who ruled during the First Great Deluge?
questions.answer: Oli Sembiyan (or early Pandyas like Jayamakirthi).

What is the "Dhruva Nakshatra"?
Who became the Pole Star?
Which star is associated with Arundhati?
questions.answer: Alcor (the companion star to Mizar in the Big Dipper/Saptarishi).

questions.question: Who are the Sapta Rishis (Seven Sages)?
questions.answer: Vasishta, Kashyapa, Atri, Jamadagni, Gautama, Vishvamitra, Bharadwaja.

questions.question: Who is the "Chiranjeevi" (Immortal) from the Ramayana?
Who is the "Chiranjeevi" from the Mahabharatha?

Who is the "Chiranjeevi" Sage?

questions.answer: A Jain practice of fasting to death.

category: XIV. Tamil Kings and Special Titles

questions.question: Which Pandyan King had the title "Palyaga Salai" (One with many sacrificial halls)?
Which Chola King had the title "Thodithot Sembiyan"?
questions.answer: A Chola King who destroyed hanging forts.

questions.question: What is the "Agastya Samhita" known for?
questions.answer: It purportedly contains descriptions of electric batteries.

questions.answer: A miraculous plank in the Golden Lotus Tank at Madurai that judged the worthiness of literary works.

questions.answer: A major bathing festival where holy rivers are believed to congregate.
